page.title: 03Norton Sand Quarry,Condover.
page.content: The Norton Sand Quarry was taken over by the Amey Road Stone Corp. in 1982 and is expected to be worked out in about 18-20 years time,when it may become a fishing or boating pool.In order to obtain planning permission ARC had to agree to screening.The earth was dug up into great big mounds all the way round the quarry,so that nobody can see the buildings.At the moment it covers about 10 acres. They cannot drain it,as the water authority have a bore hole nearby,and if the water was pumped out the bore hole would dry up .There are eight people who work there.The sand and gravel is extracted from a pool ten metres deep by a grab on a pontoon (See photo C).It is then sorted into three grades of gravel and two of sand.
